options.name: Include boilerplate
options.description: Include class definition and import statements in snippet

options.name: Set indentation count
options.description: Set the number of indentation characters to add per code level

options.name: Set indentation type
options.description: Select the character used to indent lines of code

options.name: Set request timeout
options.description: Set number of milliseconds the request should wait for a response before timing out (use 0 for infinity)

options.name: Follow redirects
options.description: Automatically follow HTTP redirects

options.name: Trim request body fields
options.description: Remove white space and additional lines that may affect the server's response

options.name: Generate multiline snippet
options.description: Split cURL command across multiple lines

options.name: Use long form options
options.description: Use the long form for cURL options (--header instead of -H)

options.name: Line continuation character
options.description: Set a character used to mark the continuation of a statement on the next line (generally, \ for OSX/Linux, ^ for Windows cmd and ` for Powershell)

options.name: Quote Type
options.description: String denoting the quote type to use (single or double) for URL (Use double quotes when running curl in cmd.exe and single quotes for the rest)

options.name: Set request timeout (in seconds)
options.description: Set number of seconds the request should wait for a response before timing out (use 0 for infinity)

options.name: Follow redirects
options.description: Automatically follow HTTP redirects

options.name: Trim request body fields
options.description: Remove white space and additional lines that may affect the server's response

options.name: Use Silent Mode
options.description: Display the requested data without showing the cURL progress meter or error messages

options.description: Set the number of indentation characters to add per code level

options.name: Set indentation type
options.description: Select the character used to indent lines of code
